Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.basic

Class GettersAndSettersFactory

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.basic.GettersAndSettersFactory
public class GettersAndSettersFactory
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains a factory method to build getters and setters for primitive and referenced items in the class and/or it's instance. All the getters an setters implements marker interface GettersAndSettersFactory.GetterAndSetter that can be used as the type of variable to store getters and setters built. All the getters and setters are not extends any common parent class, so can't be converted each other. Getters and setters support either primitive data type or referenced data type. Each primitive type has own specific getter and setter to avoid wrapping/unwrapping during data access. Total list of the getters and setters is:

  • GettersAndSettersFactory.BooleanGetterAndSetter - allow access to boolean fields in the class or instance
  • GettersAndSettersFactory.ByteGetterAndSetter - allow access to byte fields in the class or instance
  • GettersAndSettersFactory.CharGetterAndSetter - allow access to char fields in the class or instance
  • GettersAndSettersFactory.DoubleGetterAndSetter - allow access to double fields in the class or instance
  • GettersAndSettersFactory.FloatGetterAndSetter - allow access to float fields in the class or instance
  • GettersAndSettersFactory.IntGetterAndSetter - allow access to int fields in the class or instance
  • GettersAndSettersFactory.LongGetterAndSetter - allow access to long fields in the class or instance
  • GettersAndSettersFactory.ShortGetterAndSetter - allow access to short fields in the class or instance
  • GettersAndSettersFactory.ObjectGetterAndSetter - allow access to referenced fields in the class or instance

Every getter and setter contains two methods:

  • get(T instance) - get field value from the class or instance
  • set(T instance, V value) - set field value in the class or instance

According to configuration parameters and field properties, getters and setters can be implemented as:

  • hard-coded on-the-fly built inner class (use AsmWriter) functionality
  • wrapper to the MethodHandle functionality

The first one is implemented for the public fields only. Other cases produce the second variant.

Since Java 1.9, PureLibSettings.ALLOW_UNSAFE flag in the Pure Library configuration is deprecated, so any references to sun.misc.Unsafe class in this class are invalid now.

Since:
0.0.2
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
Unsafe, PureLibSettings, AsmWriter, JUnit tests
LastUpdate:
0.0.4

    • buildGetterAndSetter

      public static GettersAndSettersFactory.GetterAndSetter buildGetterAndSetter​(java.net.URI applicationPath) throws ContentException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.NullPointerException

      Build getter and setter by it's application path in model.

      Parameters:
      applicationPath - application path URI in the model
      Returns:
      getter and setter built
      Throws:
      ContentException - on any building errors
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - field name is null, empty or is missing in the class
      java.lang.NullPointerException - awaited class is null
      Since:
      0.0.3

      loader - class loader to seek class in
      Returns:
      getter and setter built

      java.lang.NullPointerException - awaited class is null

    • buildGetterAndSetter

      public static <T> GettersAndSettersFactory.GetterAndSetter buildGetterAndSetter​(java.lang.Class<T> awaited, java.lang.String fieldName) throws ContentException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.NullPointerException

      Build getter and setter for the given field in the class or instance.

      Type Parameters:
      T - instance to build getter and setter for
      Parameters:
      awaited - class containing field to get access to
      fieldName - field name to get access to
      assigner - module assigner for correct working in Java 1.9 and later
      Returns:
      getter and setter built
      Throws:
      ContentException - on any building errors
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - field name is null, empty or is missing in the class
      java.lang.NullPointerException - awaited class is null

    • buildGetterAndSetter

      public static <T> GettersAndSettersFactory.GetterAndSetter buildGetterAndSetter​(java.lang.Class<T> awaited, java.lang.String fieldName, ModuleAccessor assigner) throws ContentException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.NullPointerException

      Build getter and setter for the given field in the class or instance.

      Type Parameters:
      T - instance to build getter and setter for
      Parameters:
      awaited - class containing field to get access to
      fieldName - field name to get access to
      assigner - module assigner to allow cross-module access in Java 1.9 and higher
      Returns:
      getter and setter built
      Throws:
      ContentException - on any building errors
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - field name is null, empty or is missing in the class
      java.lang.NullPointerException - awaited class is null
      Since:
      0.0.4

    • buildInstantiator

      public static <T> GettersAndSettersFactory.Instantiator<T> buildInstantiator​(java.lang.Class<T> clazz) throws ContentException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalStateException

      Build instantiator of the class.

      Type Parameters:
      T - class to instantiate
      Parameters:
      clazz - managed class to build instantiator to
      Returns:
      instantiator for managed class
      Throws:
      ContentException - on any building errors
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - field name is null, empty or is missing in the class
      java.lang.NullPointerException - awaited class is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - awaited class is not valid
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - awaited class is not public and sun.misc.Unsafe is not available
      Since:
      0.0.3
